page.title: 06MURIESTON TRAIL, LIVINGSTON
page.content: {Murieston Trail}is a walkway and bridle path for the use of the {Livingston}public. The nature walk contains landscaped greenways, woodlands and streams and provides a habitat for a variety of animals and birds. On the trail is{Nether {Williamson,}a Georgian farmhouse which dates back to the 1600's. It was the home of{Lizzie Brice,}the last witch to be burned at the stake, in this area. On our outing we also passed {Skivo Farm,}which is an eighteenth century farmhouse. Part of this farm is now used as kennels. Two Skivo dogs followed us as far as the Murieston battery farm. We were also chased by geese from{Wester Murieston Farm.} Alongside the path we found pieces of old crockery and bottles in what we called the 'bottle field'. We followed the arrows on the trail to get home.
